# ------ STRINGS IN PYTHON ---------

= Strings as arrays of characters: =
# specifically: immutable lists
>>> astring = "Hello world!"
>>> astring[1:-4:2] # [start:stop:step]
'el o'
>>> astring[::-1]
'!dlrow olleH'
>>> astring.index("w")
6

= strip, replace characters in string =

>>> sentence = '   Python is cool!'
>>> str_1 = sentence.strip()  # strip away leading and trailing whitespace
>>> str_2 = sentence.replace('','')
>>> str_2 = sentence.replace('oo','-')
>>> str_2
'Python is c-l!'

.strip(): Removes leading and trailing characters (whitespace by default).
.lstrip(): Removes leading characters (whitespace by default) from the left side of the string.
.rstrip(): Removes trailing characters (whitespace by default) from the right side of the string.

>>> print(astring.endswith("asdfasdfasdf"))

>>> H="Harry"
>>> T="Tommy"
>>> print (f"{H} met {T}")
Harry met Tommy
>>>
>>> print ( ("{H} met {T}").format(H="Houdini", T="Torino") )
Houdini met Torino

 = Values for the % operator: =
%s - String (or any object with a string representation, like numbers)
%d - Integers
%f - Floating point numbers
%.<number of digits>f - Floating point numbers with a fixed amount of digits to the right of the dot.
%x/%X - Integers in hex representation (lowercase/uppercase)
